Th© NAEB Publications Coaanittes convened in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, November

th® implementation of a survey to determine the number of colleges and universities

Januarv«5tebruarv issue of the Journal as a yearbook; a proposal to increase the

newsletters; and a policy for publications responsibility.
1) The Committee regretfully accepted the resignation of Dr. Walter B.
Emery as Editor. Dr. Emexy will be on sabbatical leave from Michigan State
University during the academic year 1961**65 and it appears that a large portion
of this leave will be spent outside the country*
In discussing possible replacements, the Committee selected and approved
a list of three candidates. President William G« Harley will contact the
potential candidates.
2) The Committee unanimously approved a motion that, in the future, the
membership of the Publications Committee should reflect the various interest
groups (W station division, radio station division, etc.) within the reorganized
Association.
3) Dr. Presley Holmes* proposal for a survey to determine the number of
colleges and universities that grant "publication*1 credit to faculty for air
work was approved.
Implementation of the proposal follows* Holmes will prepare the questionnaire,
(see attached) it will be printed rather than dittoed or mimeographed, and Cordier
will distribute to the one hundred largest institutions with radio, television,
closed-circuit, or instruction film programs. The questionnaire will be
distributed through the membership at each institution and returned to Cordier
for tabulating.
Other professional education groups (l.e., NEA, DAVI, SAA, AAUP, and the
APBE) interested in this problem will be infomed of the study.
The Committee also expressed the hope that the NAEB Board of Directors
will take official action on the final report, thereby developing a national
policy.
